sn4.2:3.1: 2 In the Form of an Elephant King
sn4.2:4.2: At one time, when he was first awakened, the Buddha was staying near Uruvelā at the root of the goatherd’s banyan tree on the bank of the Nerañjarā River.
sn4.2:4.3: Now at that time the Buddha was meditating in the open during the dark of night, while a gentle rain drizzled down.
sn4.2:4.4: Then Māra the Wicked, wanting to make the Buddha feel fear, terror, and goosebumps, manifested in the form of a huge elephant king and approached him.
sn4.2:4.5: Its head was like a huge block of soapstone.
sn4.2:4.7: Its tusks were like pure silver.
sn4.2:4.9: Its trunk was like a long plough pole.
sn4.2:4.11: Then the Buddha, knowing that this was Māra the Wicked, addressed him in verse:
sn4.2:5.2: you’ve made forms beautiful and ugly.
sn4.2:6.1: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The Buddha knows me! The Holy One knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
